Content.Text:
<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>...? Oh. Hello.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hm? I look "dazed"? What are you talking about?
<PAGE>
Never mind that for now. Please let me know
when you walk in. It's jarring to see you appear
right in front of me.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
What? You did? Really? I'm sorry, I must not
have noticed.
<PAGE>
So what brings you here today? You don't look
unwell.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
You simply wanted to visit me? I...see. Thank
you. I'm flattered.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hm? What do you mean, "I seem different
today"?
<PAGE>
I'm sorry, <MYNAME>, but you are deeply
confusing me.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Anyway, I'm afraid I am working right now. If
you have personal business with me, please
come back once I'm off the clock.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, what are you fussing about?

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I don't look well? "Lie down"? Seriously,
<MYNAME>, what on earth are you talking
about?
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>I'm sorry, but I don't have time for this. Please
stop talking and let me work.
Put her to bed.
Stand back and watch.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Huh?

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Wh-what are you doing?

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I told you, I'm feeling just fine...

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
<WINDOW_DISCOURAGEMENT_R>A-all right. So perhaps I'm not quite a hundred
percent right now.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
<WINDOW_DISCOURAGEMENT_R>Please don't be so upset. It's...unsettling.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
How is she, doctor?

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
She'll be just fine. It's just a little cold. As long
as she gets some rest, she'll be right as rain
again in no time.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>Still, it looks like the poor dear was pushing
herself all morning long.
<PAGE>
<WINDOW_DISCOURAGEMENT_L>She hid her condition so well even I didn't
notice. I can hardly believe I was so blind.

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
<WINDOW_PLEASANT_L>Fortunately, <MYNAME> was on the ball and
noticed right away. Well done, honey!
Boyfriends always notice those things.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
I see. It's always been this way.
<PAGE>
Even as a child, Angela would never let on when
she was ill. Sometimes she herself wouldn't
notice.
<PAGE>
And I could never see it myself, either, not until
she was almost ready to collapse.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
But it seems we managed to catch it before it
got too bad this time. Thank you, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Excellent! Well then, I have other patients to see
too. Call me if you need anything, honey.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
I'm her own mother, and when she's ill, I'm still
completely oblivious. I am a failure as a parent.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, thank you, <MYNAME>. But it is true.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Once, shortly after my husband passed away
and I took over the guild, she caught a cold.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>That morning, I noticed that she sounded a little
strange, but I didn't think anything of it at the
time.
<PAGE>
When I came home, very late that night, I was
shocked to find her face down on the kitchen
table, unconscious.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
That day was my birthday.
<PAGE>
Countless dishes for a birthday dinner lay
untouched on the tabletop.
<PAGE>
I saw that she had pushed herself to cook all
that food, and then stayed awake waiting for
me, despite being ill.
<PAGE>
Then and there, I swore that I would pay more
attention, so that I would never miss any signs
of illness again.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
But Angela is a very bright child. I'm sure she
must have spotted the change in the way I
watched her.
<PAGE>
To make sure she never caused me any trouble,
she learned how to hide all her symptoms, no
matter how ill she was feeling.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Remember how I said that she herself wouldn't
even notice how she felt?
<PAGE>
To be more precise, it seems more that she
automatically pretends she's fine without even
realizing it.
<PAGE>
I believe a part of her thinks that, if she doesn't
let the sickness get to her, it won't matter.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>As a nurse, she should know better than any of
us that the body isn't nearly that simple.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
But the one who backed her into that corner,
who forced her to push herself too far and think
like that, is none other than me.
<PAGE>
I, more than anyone, should be the one to see
when she's pushing herself too hard, the one to
tell her to stop and rest.
<PAGE>
But did I? No, yet again, I did not. Truly, I am a
failure as a mother.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
You are so kind, <MYNAME>. I am very glad that
you're the one to be there for her.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL><MYNAME>? Might I ask a favor of you?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
No matter how hard I try, I continually miss the
signs of Angela's illnesses.
<PAGE>
As long as I remain Guild Master, I don't foresee
that changing.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Could I ask you to be there for her instead, and
to see what I can't?
<PAGE>
Then, maybe someday, we can teach her that
she doesn't need to hold back, and that she can
lean on us and ask us for help.
<PAGE>
For all that she keeps inside, I do know that she
trusts you very much.
<PAGE>
At home, she often talks about you happily, at
length.
<PAGE>
I'm sure she would trust you well enough to let
you know when she isn't feeling her best.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Could I ask you for that?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Thank you.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Well then, I must be getting back to my work.
Please take good care of her.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh...And could I also ask you not to tell Angela
what we talked about?
<PAGE>
In fact, I would be happiest if you'd refrain from
mentioning that I stopped by at all.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
If she discovers that I skipped work in order to
come see her, she will feel responsible for it.
<PAGE>
So please...I wasn't here. I haven't even heard
that she collapsed. Could we leave it at that?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thank you, <MYNAME>, for going along with
me. And...I'm sorry. Now, if you'll excuse me...

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I never realized my mother felt that way.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
It's all right. I'm feeling much better now. I'm
sorry for causing you so much trouble.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
And my mother... I never realized I was causing
her so much grief.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, never once have I thought of my
mother as any kind of failure, least of all at
parenting.
<PAGE>
No matter what anyone says, I have always been
proud of her.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
When my father passed away, she took over
running the guild.
<PAGE>
She was so busy she barely had time to sleep,
yet all by herself she managed to raise me into
the person I am now.
<PAGE>
With everything she's had to do, of course she'd
have had trouble recognizing tiny changes in her
child's condition.
<PAGE>
Especially when that child was doing her best to
hide them.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
My whole life, I thought that reducing my
mother's burdens, that doing everything I could
to leave her in peace...
<PAGE>
...and not to bother her would be the best help I
could provide.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>But it looks like I may have been wrong.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Some time ago, a mother brought her child in to
the doctor. She said something to me then...
<PAGE>
"Nothing is sadder for a parent than to know
your children are trying to take care of you, and
not the other way around."
<PAGE>
"Children ought to be children, leaning on their
parents for care and guidance until they're
grown. Then they can give back."

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
When I first heard her say that, I didn't agree. But
now, I can't help but put myself in my mother's
place.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>If I were her, and my daughter tried to hide her
illness so hard she collapsed, just so she
wouldn't bother me...
<PAGE>
...that would be a terribly sad and painful thing
to endure.
<PAGE>
And I've made my mother endure that pain this
whole time.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I guess I'm all grown up now anyway, so I can't
let her pamper me now.
<PAGE>
But I can engage my mother on equal terms, as
a fellow adult.
<PAGE>
From now on, I'll make sure neither of us is one-
sidedly taking care of the other.
<PAGE>
When I get home, I'll sit down with her and talk
about that.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
<WINDOW_PALPITATION_L>Thank you, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
If you hadn't noticed I wasn't feeling well and
forced me to rest...
<PAGE>
...then nothing would have changed. I never
would have heard what my mother really
thought.
<PAGE>
You've given us the chance to change our
relationship for the better. Thank you very much.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOVE>
<WINDOW_PALPITATION_L>I, er...I'm very happy to be with you.
<PAGE>
So, um, <MYNAME>? I hope you and I will stay
together for a long time to come.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOVE>
<WINDOW_HEART1_L>Goodness...I really shouldn't say such things so
often. I'm feeling incredibly embarrassed now.
<PAGE>
<MYNAME>, would you please stop staring?
You're making me feel so warm it might bring
my fever back.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>
<MYNAME>, did you hear me? I asked you to
leave me be and come back later.

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh! Hello <MYNAME>, honey! You're looking
fabulous as always today.

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Goodness! Angela, sweetie, you have a fever!
How long have you had it?

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
<MYNAME>! You were just talking to her, right?
<PAGE>
How could you not notice?! Ugh! Curse that
thick, masculine skull of yours!
<PAGE>
Out of the way, now! Out! Out!

I later heard that she'd caught a cold. After
taking some cold medicine and a nap, she felt
better.
<PAGE>
Maybe I should've said something when I
noticed she wasn't looking right. I should have
at least put her to bed...

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
...?
